titleStmt.title: O Rourke's noble Feast will ne'er be forgot

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: from a literal translation of the original Irish
by Dean Swift
O Rourke's noble fare will ne'er be forgot
By those who were there or those who were not
His revels to keep we sup & we dine
On seven score sheep fat bullocks & Swine
Usquebagh to our feast in pails is brought up
A hundred at least & a Madder our Cup
Come Harper strike up, but first by your favor
Boy give us a Cup, Ah, this has some savour
O'Rourke's jolly boys ne'er dream't of the matter
Till rous'd by the noise & musical clatter
They·bounce from their nest, no longer will tarry dance in a round cutting Capers & rampingThey are ready drest without one Ave Mary·A mercy the Ground did not burst with their stamping
Bring Straw for our bed, shake it down to the feet
Then over us spread the winnowing sheet
To shew I dont flinch fill the bowl up again
Then give us a pinch of your sneeshin, a yean
Good Lord! what a sight after all their good cheer
For people to fight in the midst of their Beer!
You Churl, I'll maintain my Father built Lusk overLeek inpencil
The Castle of Slane & Carrick Drumrusk
The Earl of Kildare & Moy overg inpencilnalta his brother
As great as they are, I was nurs'd by their Mother
Ask that of old Madam, she'll tell you who's who
As far up as Adam, she knows it is true244-410L
